data.title: Members - The Trapani Lab at Amherst College
data.snippet:
#### Ha Dong '26

'26 Neuroscience Thesis Student  
 Former Lab Research Student  
 Ha is a senior from Hanoi, Vietnam, tri-majoring in Physics, Mathematics, and Neuroscience. Ha is interested in how different sensory modalities shape behaviors and plans to pursue a Ph.D. degree. Outside the lab, Ha works with the Center for Teaching and Learning and the Strategic Learning Center to help improve the teaching and learning on campus. In his free time, you would find him taking photographs or biking along the Norwottuck Rail Trail, trying out new coffee recipes, or jamming with friends with his cajon. Learn more about him here: 

#### Shirley Fu '26 [...] #### Allie Platt '26

'26 Neuroscience Thesis Student  
 Allie Platt (she/her) is a senior from Brooklyn, New York. She is majoring in neuroscience on the pre-med track. Outside the lab, she is co-founder and co-president of the figure skating club, an EMT on ACEMS, and a Peer Educator. In her free time, she loves to listen to music (tune in to Hyperfixstation on WAMH), explore a new coffee shop, and travel.

#### Ha Dong '26 [...] Current research in the Trapani lab continues to try to understand how external sensory stimuli are transformed into meaningful neuronal information. Joe is also committed to addressing issues of access, equity, and inclusion in STEM.

# Dong Ha Kim

Ewha Womans University

### Biography

Prof. Dong Ha Kim received Ph.D. degree in the Department of Fiber and Polymer Science at Seoul National University in 2000.

He carried out postdoctoral research activities in the Polymer Science and Engineering Department at the University of Massachusetts at Amherst (from 2000 to 2003) with Prof. Thomas P. Russell and in the Materials Science Department at the Max Planck Institute for Polymer Research (from 2003 to 2005) with Prof. Wolfgang Knoll. [...] Prof. Dong Ha Kim's research interests include development of hybrid nanostructures for energy storage and conversion, environmental remediation, non-volatile memory devices, display devices, and biomedical diagnosis/therapy. He has authored 165 SCI publications and holds 32 Korean and 2 US patents. Currently, he is Fellow of Royal Society of Chemistry, Associate Editor of Nanoscale/Nanoscale Advances, Editorial Board Member of Scientific Reports and Advisory Board Member of Nanoscale Horizons and Journal of Materials Chemistry A.

### RSC affiliations
